profile_positions.title: Reviewer

profile_positions.description: Guest lecturer during the Master course "Biography of Landscape", Heritage Studies.
profile_positions.title: Guest Lecturer Biography of Landscape

profile_positions.description: After completing my BA in Archaeology at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, I continued my academic education with both a MA in interdisciplinary Heritage Studies and a MA in Archaeology. I specialized myself in the Heritage, Memory and Archaeology of recent conflict situations and was the first in the Netherlands to focus my academic education on Modern Conflict Archaeology. I participated in a number of archaeological field projects on Second World War heritage, such as the excavations at Kamp Amersfoort in 2010. After completing my MA theses I worked as a junior researcher at CLUE/VU Amsterdam for the NWO Odyssey pilot project 'Buried Past of War' (2011). This was the first systematic inventory and analysis of features and findings of the Second World War in the Netherlands found during archaeological excavations between 1970 and 2010. Afterwards I worked as a junior researcher at the cluster ‘Heritage and Memory of Conflict and War’, also at CLUE/VU Amsterdam. In June 2014 I obtained an ARCHON-grant for my PhD research: ‘Buried Landscapes of War: The archaeology and heritage of the Second World War in The Netherlands.’ This is the first academic research of Modern Conflict Archaeology in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate Modern Conflict Archaeology
